name: snagging
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
snag
the act of dealing with minor faults with houses that have just been built: We had no problems with the builders and the snagging was done on time. Once you've paid for the property in full, there's little incentive for the builder to complete the snagging list.
More examplesFewer examplesSnagging problems continually postponed the opening date of the spa.After a huge spurt of energy with staircases, plasterers, and windows, the last bits and bobs (what builders call snagging) are taking forever. The most common problems snagging companies deal with are messy plastering, slapdash paintwork and shoddy carpentry.
